meanings.definition: To surpass in driving or moving forward.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outdrive all her competitors in the race.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outdrive his personal best time when running.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident he could outdrive him.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed allowed her to outdrive any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind helped the sailboat outdrive the other boats in the regatta.

meanings.definition: A device used to transfer power from an engine to a propeller in a boat.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic inspected the outdrive to ensure it was functioning properly.
meanings.sent2: The outdrive of the boat needed maintenance before the summer season.
meanings.sent3: The outdrive of the boat hummed happily as it propelled the vessel forward.
meanings.sent4: The outdrive of the boat was like the heart, pumping power to move the boat.
meanings.sent5: The shiny outdrive gleamed in the sunlight as the boat cruised along the river.
